body_html:
Apologies for the confusing API. I hope to **remove the dynamic_rnn_decoder function next week**; it's limited and bug-prone. We have a new object oriented API which should be much easier to use (examples of use here <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/seq2seq/python/kernel_tests/decoder_test.py#L132>). What remains is adding a Decoder that supports attention; it should go in in the next week or two. Then we will remove the old function-based approach from the repo.
…

body:
Apologies for the confusing API.

I hope to **remove the dynamic_rnn_decoder function next week**; it's
limited and bug-prone.  We have a new object oriented API which should be
much easier to use (examples of use here
<https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/seq2seq/python/kernel_tests/decoder_test.py#L132>).
What remains is adding a Decoder that supports attention; it should go in
in the next week or two.  Then we will remove the old function-based
approach from the repo.

On Wed, Feb 8, 2017 at 7:48 AM, Geoffrey Irving <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @ebrevdo <https://github.com/ebrevdo> Where did the initial state go?
> It's not obvious to me either from the code.
